resource.name: Building Energy Performance Survey Data
resource.description:
One of the specific objectives of the USAID/Vietnam Clean Energy Program is to develop a comprehensive database of buildings in collaboration with the Departments of Constructions in five cities to identify almost all larger buildings (with Gross Floor Area [GFA] equal to or greater than 2,500 m2) that have been constructed during the last 10 years (building stock). The Building Stock Sample contains some 1,400 large buildings of all categories and representative of 3 typical climate zones:
• Northern zone (Hanoi & Hai Phong cities): 490 buildings
• Central zone (Danang city): 316 buildings
• Southern zone (Ho Chi Minh and Can Tho cities): 623 buildings

The stock data contains basic information for each building, including building type, year built, total floor area; many buildings contain extra information such as number of stories, number of lifts, type and size of electric generator, etc. For the detailed building energy performance survey, the Program’s approach is to randomly select 280 buildings (20%) from Departments of Construction sample stocks of buildings for a detailed survey. For the credibility of collected data, surveyed buildings must be statistically representative of each climate zone and building type/size category. For each climate zone, the optimal sample size will contain at least five buildings in each of the building categories. All data went through a third party quality assurance check.

resource.name: Feed the Future Uganda Interim Survey in the Zone of Influence, Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index-Recode File
resource.description: Feed the Future Uganda Interim Survey in the Zone of Infuence: This dataset (n=664, vars=162) contains the analytical variables derived in the WEAI analysis.
columns_description: This variable is a recode of G303_E. It indicates that the individual can decide to sell the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Fish pond or fishing equipment

This variable is a recode of creditselfjointborrow_e, creditselfjointuse_e. This variable indicates that the individual has been involved in decisionmaking on the credit taken from SOURCE . SOURCE Group based micro-finance or lending including VSLAs SACCOs merry-go-rounds

This variable is the sum of variables incomedec_a, incomedec_b, incomedec_c, incomedec_d, incomedec_e, incomedec_f, feelmakedec_e, feelmakedec_f, feelmakedec_g. It shows the number of domains in which the individual has some input in income decisions or feels she can make decisions regarding incomes.

This variable is the sum of variables feelmakedec_a, feelmakedec_b, feelmakedec_c, feelmakedec_d, inputdec_a, inputdec_b, inputdec_c, inputdec_f. It shows the number of agricultural domains in which the individual has some input in decisions or feels that she can make decisions. Missing values on individual variables are treated as zero during summation, and individuals only have a missing value on this measure when all summed values are missing.

This variable is a recode of G203_D. The variable indicates that an individual has decisionmaking ability over income generated from ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the individual if the individual has input into some decisions (2) or input into most or all decisions (3). Those who have no input or input into very few decisions (1) are coded as a zero. Those who do not participate in an activity (G2.01 2), report that no decision was made (G203 93), or refuse (G203 99) are coded as missing. ACTIVITY Non-farm economic activities: This would include things like running a small business, self-employment, buy-and-sell
Survey Date

This variable is a recode of selfjointsell_f, selfjointgive_f, selfjointrent_f, and selfjointbuy_f. It means that the respondent has AT LEAST ONE right over the ITEM . ITEM Farm equipment (non-mechanized: Country-specific examples)
Administrative variable for identifying households

This variable is a recode of G404_G. The variable indicates that the respondent knows of this type of group in her community. Women who respond No or indicate that they do not know are coded as a 0 on this measure. GROUP

This variable is a recode of G404_F. The variable indicates that the respondent knows of this type of group in her community. Women who respond No or indicate that they do not know are coded as a 0 on this measure. GROUP
This variable is a recode of G303_D. It indicates that the individual can decide to sell the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigeons

This variable is a recode of G201_E. It is coded as 1 if the individual participated in the ACTIVITY within the past 12 months. It is coded 0 otherwise. Those who do not know, refuse, or have missing data are treated as missing on this recoded measure. ACTIVITY Wage and salary employment: This could be work that is paid for in cash or in-kind, including both agriculture and other wage work

This variable is a recode of G501_G, G502_G. The variable represents whether the woman makes decisions or feels that she could make decisions regarding ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the woman is the sole person who makes decisions (G5.01) or if the woman feels that she could make a decision (G5.02) regarding ACTIVITY . The woman is counted as feeling she could make a decision if she indicated to a small extent (2), medium extent (3), or to a high extent (4). ACTIVITY Minor household expenditures (such as food for daily consumption or other household needs)

This variable is a recode of selfjointrightany_a, selfjointrightany_b, selfjointrightany_c, selfjointrightany_d, selfjointrightany_e, selfjointrightany_f, and selfjointrightany_g. This variable is the indicator for the purchase, sale, or transfer of assets. It indicates that the individual has the right to purchase, sell, or transfer at least two assets or that the individual has the right to purchase, sell or transfer one asset as long as that asset is not chicken or non-mechanized farm equipment.

This variable is a recode of G305_F. It indicates that the individual can decide to rent the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Farm equipment (non-mechanized: Country-specific examples)

This variable is a recode of G201_A. It is coded as 1 if the individual participated in the ACTIVITY within the past 12 months. It is coded 0 otherwise. Those who do not know, refuse, or have missing data are treated as missing on this recoded measure. ACTIVITY Food crop farming: These are crops that are grown primarily for household food consumption
Child s ID code

This variable is a recode of G202_B. The variable indicates that an individual has decisionmaking ability over ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the individual has input into some decisions (G202 2) or input into most or all decisions (G202 3). ACTIVITY Cash crop farming: These are crops that are grown primarily for sale in market
This variable is a recode of G302_N. It indicates that the individual owns most of the ITEM either solely or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Means of transportation (Country-specific examples)

This variable is the indicator for group member. It identifies women who are an active member of at least 1 community group as adequate. Women who are not a member of at least one community group are considered inadequate.

This variable is a recode of G501_F, G502_F. The variable represents whether the woman makes decisions or feels that she could make decisions regarding ACTIVITY . The woman is counted as feeling she could make a decision if she indicated to a small extent (2), medium extent (3), or to a high extent (4). This variable is the indicator for sufficient leisure time. The variables identifies women who are satisfied with their leisure time as adequate, and women who are dissatisfied with their leisure time as inadequate. Satisfaction is defined as a score of 5 or higher on the 1-10 rating in G6.02.

This variable is a recode of G304_C. It indicates that the individual can decide to give away the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Small livestock (Country-specific examples)

This variable is the indicator for asset ownership. An individual is adequate if she owns at least two small assets (chicken, farming equipment non-mechanized, and small consumer durables) or one large asset. This measure is based on the selfjointown_sum measure. This is the same as saying: empowered if owns AT LEAST ONE asset and that asset is not a small asset. Inadequate if lives in a household that owns no assets.

resource.name: REVIVE Climate Change Adaptation in Oromia, Ethiopia: Baseline Dataset
resource.description:
The baseline dataset for this study contains 1439 observations over 156 variables. The data describe animal numbers with some socio-demographic information and some opinions.

These data come from the Restoring Vibrant Villages and Environments (REVIVE) project in 9 woredas of Oromia region of Ethiopia. Project REVIVE is a three­year project to increase vulnerable communities’ long­term resilience to climate change and climate­-related shocks.

domain_metadata.value: Jason Rubin. 2019. REVIVE Climate Change Adaptation in Oromia, Ethiopia: Baseline Dataset. Dataset. USAID Development Data Library. https://data.usaid.gov/d/yu79-vkkx.

resource.name: Agricultural Land Dynamics and Land Policy in Rural Tanzania 2016: Livestock Costs Dataset
resource.description:
This dataset contains information about costs associated with livestock inputs. The table can be combined with other datasets in this data asset using the 'hhid' column.

The purpose of collecting these data was to examine farm expansion and labor markets in rural Tanzania. Data were collected in 8 rural districts of Tanzania: Mvomero, Kilombero, Njombe, Kiteto, Magu, Moshi Rural, Mkuranga and Liwale.

The data were collected through the Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Food Security Policy (FSP).

domain_metadata.value: Margaret Beaver. 2019. Agricultural Land Dynamics and Land Policy in Rural Tanzania 2016: Livestock Costs Dataset. Dataset. USAID Development Data Library. https://data.usaid.gov/d/yv95-8ztk.
See the word document "2016_ALDSDataFileNotes.doc" for details on specific variables that may have data issues. Some plot areas were not allocated by crop but given as total area (see notes)
